alert.note: Alert for Inland Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 5:38PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WHARTON... SOUTHWESTERN BRAZORIA AND NORTH CENTRAL MATAGORDA COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM CST... At 537 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bay City, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Jackson, Angleton, Bay City, Clute, West Columbia, Sweeny, Richwood, Brazoria, Holiday Lakes, Bailey`s Prairie, Wild Peach Village, Markham, and Van Vleck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CST for southeastern Texas.
